description: [Status: stable] [Name: superfluous-else-return] [Message: Unnecessary {branch} after return statement] What it does Checks for else statements with a return statement in the preceding if block. Why is this bad? The else statement is not needed as the return statement will always break out of the enclosing function. Removing the else will reduce nesting and make the code more readable. Example def foo(bar, baz): if bar: return 1 else: return baz Use instead: def foo(bar, baz): if bar: return 1 return baz
